org.xchain.framework.lifecycle

Class Execution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.lifecycle.Execution

  • public final class Execution
extends java.lang.Object
    The Execution class manages the context and execution stacks.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Devon Tackett, Josh Kennedy

      • startExecution

        public static void startExecution(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext globalContext)
        Start an execution stack on the current thread.
        Parameters:
        globalContext - The global JXPathContext for this execution.

      • endExecution

        public static void endExecution()
                         throws ExecutionException
        End all execution for this thread. All contexts will be cleared.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - If an exception was thrown during execution it will be wrapped in an ExecutionException.

      • inExecution

        public static boolean inExecution()
        Returns true if a command is currently executing.

      • startCommandExecute

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext startCommandExecute(Command command,
                                                          org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        Signals that the execute method of a command has been called. If this command is registered with a catalog, then a new local context is created based on the current context that was passed in.

        NOTE: This command is used by the engineering framework and should not be called directly by command implementations.

        Parameters:
        command - the command that is being executed.
        context - the current local context or the global context.
        Returns:
        the current local context. If the command is registered with a catalog, then the context returned is the new local context for this command. Otherwise, the context returned will be the same as the context passed in.

      • startContextPointer

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext startContextPointer(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context,
                                                          org.apache.commons.jxpath.Pointer contextPointer)

        Signals that we are creating a local context for context bean that has the same variable and function scope as the last context bean.

        The user can safely call this method.

        Parameters:
        context - the current local context.
        contextPointer - A Pointer to the new context bean.
        Returns:
        the new local context that shares variables and namespace context with the previous local context, but it has a new context bean.

      • endCommandExecute

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext endCommandExecute(Command command,
                                                        org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        Executed at the end of a command's execute method if it is not a filter or at the end of a command's postProcess method if it is a filter. This method will change the current local context if the current command is registered with a catalog.

        NOTE: This command is used by the engineering framework and should not be called directly by command implementations.

        Parameters:
        context - the current local context.
        Returns:
        the previous local context on the context stack.

      • stopContextPointer

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext stopContextPointer(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        End the current context pointer.

        Parameters:
        context - the local context to stop.
        Returns:
        the new local context.

      • endCommandPostProcess

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext endCommandPostProcess(Command command,
                                                            org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        Marks the end of a commands post process method.

        NOTE: This command is used by the engineering framework and should not be called directly by command implementations.

        Parameters:
        context - the current local context.
        Returns:
        the previous local context on the context stack.

      • suspendContextPointer

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext suspendContextPointer(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        Suspends a local context for a context pointer.

        Parameters:
        context - the current local context.
        Returns:
        the new local context.

      • startCommandPostProcess

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext startCommandPostProcess(Command command,
                                                              org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)
        Resumes the top item on the suspended context stack.

        NOTE: This command is used by the engineering framework and should not be called directly by command implementations.

        Parameters:
        context - the current local context.
        Returns:
        the context that was resumed.

      • definePrefixMappings

        public static void definePrefixMappings(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context,
                        EngineeredCommand command)
        Add all custom prefixes for the given command to the context. PrefixMappings are stored in a stack. The last prefix mapping that is defined must be the first one undefined. Any prefixes that conflict with the command's prefixes will have their original values saved and will be restored once the prefix mapping is undefined for the given command.
        Parameters:
        context - The context being used.
        command - The command whose custom prefixes are to be used.

      • undefinePrefixMappings

        public static void undefinePrefixMappings(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context,
                          EngineeredCommand command)
        Remove all custom prefixes for the given command from the context. Prefix mappings are stored in a stack. The latest prefix mapping that has been defined must be the first one undefined. When a prefix mapping is undefined any prefixes that conflicted with the command's prefixes will have their original values restored.
        Parameters:
        context - The context being used.
        command - The command whose custom prefixes are to be undefined.

      • resumeContextPointer

        public static org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext resumeContextPointer(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context)

        This method is used to resume a suspended context pointer.

        Parameters:
        context - the current context.
        Returns:
        the context that was resumed.

      • exceptionThrown

        public static void exceptionThrown(Command command,
                   java.lang.Exception exception)
        Called by engineered commands to notify that an exception is propagating from an execute(JXPathContext) method.

      • getSystemId

        public static java.lang.String getSystemId()
        Returns the system id for the currently executing command.

      • getExecutionTrace

        public static java.util.List<ExecutionTraceElement> getExecutionTrace()
        Returns a copy of the current execution trace stack. This list contains all of the currently executing xchains starting with the current chain and anding with the first chain that was called.
